description: Regular physical activity is crucial for physical and mental well-being. It improves cardiovascular health, strengthens muscles, boosts mood, and helps in weight management.
sentences: Aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic exercise or 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity exercise per week.
Incorporate strength training exercises at least two days a week.
Consistency is more important than intensity.
Listen to your body and allow for rest and recovery.
Find an activity you enjoy to make it a sustainable habit.
dos: Warm-up before exercising and cool-down afterwards.
Stay hydrated before, during, and after your workout.
Use proper form to prevent injuries.
Gradually increase the intensity and duration of your workouts.
donts: Don't overtrain or push through sharp pain.
Don't compare your progress to others.
Don't expect immediate results; be patient and consistent.
